security_audit.summary: The mcp-builder skill is a documentation and guidance tool for building MCP servers. The 599 static findings are overwhelmingly false positives caused by the scanner flagging documentation content (code examples, security best practices) as executable code. The actual Python scripts (connections.py, evaluation.py) implement legitimate MCP server connections and evaluations without any malicious behavior.

low_findings.title: External command execution in evaluation script
low_findings.description: The evaluation.py script can execute external commands via stdio transport to spawn MCP server processes. This is legitimate intended functionality for testing MCP servers, controlled by documented arguments.

content.user_title: Build MCP servers with expert guidance
content.value_statement: Creating MCP servers requires deep knowledge of protocol specifications, agent-centric design, and evaluation methodologies. This skill provides comprehensive guidance, reference implementations, and evaluation tools to build high-quality MCP servers that enable effective LLM-tool integration.
actual_capabilities: Provides complete MCP server development workflow with 4 phases
Includes Python and TypeScript implementation guides with code examples
Offers evaluation harness for testing MCP server effectiveness
Contains best practices for tool design, naming, and error handling
Provides reference documentation for MCP protocol and SDKs
limitations: Requires external MCP SDK documentation via WebFetch
Evaluation scripts need Anthropic API key for testing
Focuses on read-only operations in evaluation examples
Server implementation requires separate development environment

output: Phase 3: Add error handling for rate limits
Plan tools for repos, issues, PRs

best_practices: Design tools for complete workflows, not just individual API endpoints
Use agent-centric design with clear, actionable error messages
Implement both JSON and Markdown response formats for flexibility
anti_patterns: Don't simply wrap existing APIs without thoughtful consolidation
Avoid returning excessive data that wastes LLM context tokens
Never skip input validation and proper error handling

faq.question: Which programming languages does this support?
faq.answer: The skill provides guides for both Python (with FastMCP) and Node/TypeScript implementations.

faq.question: Do I need an Anthropic API key for evaluations?
faq.answer: Yes, the evaluation script requires an Anthropic API key to test MCP server effectiveness.

faq.question: Can I test my MCP server during development?
faq.answer: Use the evaluation harness with test questions, or run the server in tmux with appropriate timeouts.

faq.question: How do I handle authentication in MCP servers?
faq.answer: Follow OAuth and security best practices using environment variables for credentials.

faq.question: What makes a good MCP tool?
faq.answer: Tools should enable complete workflows, have clear names, and provide actionable error messages.

faq.question: How do I ensure my MCP server is high quality?
faq.answer: Create comprehensive evaluations with 10+ complex questions requiring multiple tool calls.
